external_references.description: The Sandfly Security Team. (2022, May 11). BPFDoor - An Evasive Linux Backdoor Technical Analysis. Retrieved September 29, 2023.

objects.description: [BPFDoor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1161) overwrites the `argv[0]` value used by the Linux `/proc` filesystem to determine the command line and command name to display for each process. [BPFDoor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1161) selects a name from 10 hardcoded names that resemble Linux system daemons, such as; `/sbin/udevd -d`, `dbus-daemon --system`, `avahi-daemon: chroot helper`, `/sbin/auditd -n`, and `/usr/lib/systemd/systemd-journald`.(Citation: Sandfly BPFDoor 2022)
